segment.source: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi
segment.target: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi

segment.source: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi
segment.target: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi

segment.source: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi
segment.target: How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi

segment.source: This topic describes how to install the App-V client by using the setup.msi program.
segment.target: This topic describes how to install the App-V client by using the setup.msi program.

segment.source: Before you install the App-V client using the setup.msi program, you must first determine if any prerequisite software must be installed, and then you must install it.
segment.target: Before you install the App-V client using the setup.msi program, you must first determine if any prerequisite software must be installed, and then you must install it.

segment.source: To install the prerequisite software, see the Installing Prerequisite Software section of this topic.
segment.target: To install the prerequisite software, see the Installing Prerequisite Software section of this topic.

segment.source: To install the client software, see the Installing the App-V Client Using the Setup.msi Program section of this topic.
segment.target: To install the client software, see the Installing the App-V Client Using the Setup.msi Program section of this topic.

segment.source: Installing Prerequisite Software
segment.target: Installing Prerequisite Software

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to install the prerequisite software.
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to install the prerequisite software.

segment.source: You can create a command file and run the commands from the command prompt, or you can use a scripting language such as VBScript or Windows PowerShell to run the commands.
segment.target: You can create a command file and run the commands from the command prompt, or you can use a scripting language such as VBScript or Windows PowerShell to run the commands.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The x86 versions of the following software are required for both x86 and x64 versions of the App-V client.
segment.target: The x86 versions of the following software are required for both x86 and x64 versions of the App-V client.

segment.source: To install Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)
segment.target: To install Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)

segment.source: Download the Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86) software package from the Microsoft Download Center (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=119961).
segment.target: Download the Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86) software package from the Microsoft Download Center (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=119961).

segment.source: Template Token Value For version 4.5 SP2 and later of the App-V client, download vcredistx86.exe from Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package ATL Security Update (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=169360).Template Token Value
segment.target: Template Token Value For version 4.5 SP2 and later of the App-V client, download vcredistx86.exe from Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package ATL Security Update (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=169360).Template Token Value

segment.source: To install silently, use the command-line option “/Q” with vcredistx86.exe—for example, vcredistx86.exe /Q.
segment.target: To install silently, use the command-line option “/Q” with vcredistx86.exe—for example, vcredistx86.exe /Q.

segment.source: To install the software by using the vcredistx86.msi file, use the command-line option “/C /T:fullpathtofolder” to extract the files vcredist.msi and vcredis1.cab from vcredistx86.exe to a temporary folder.
segment.target: To install the software by using the vcredistx86.msi file, use the command-line option “/C /T:fullpathtofolder” to extract the files vcredist.msi and vcredis1.cab from vcredistx86.exe to a temporary folder.

segment.source: To install silently, use the command-line option /quiet—for example, msiexec /i vcredist.msi /quiet.
segment.target: To install silently, use the command-line option /quiet—for example, msiexec /i vcredist.msi /quiet.

segment.source: To install Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)
segment.target: To install Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For version 4.6 and later of the App-V client, you must also install the Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package ATL Security Update.
segment.target: For version 4.6 and later of the App-V client, you must also install the Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package ATL Security Update.

segment.source: Download the Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package ATL Security Update software package from the Microsoft Download Center (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=150700).
segment.target: Download the Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 Service Pack 1 Redistributable Package ATL Security Update software package from the Microsoft Download Center (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=150700).

segment.source: To install silently, use the command-line option “/Q” with vcredistx86.exe—for example, vcredistx86.exe /Q.
segment.target: To install silently, use the command-line option “/Q” with vcredistx86.exe—for example, vcredistx86.exe /Q.

segment.source: To install Microsoft Core XML Services (MSXML) 6.0 SP1 (x86)
segment.target: To install Microsoft Core XML Services (MSXML) 6.0 SP1 (x86)

segment.source: Download the Microsoft Core XML Services (MSXML) 6.0 SP1 (x86) software package from the Microsoft Download Center (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=63266).
segment.target: Download the Microsoft Core XML Services (MSXML) 6.0 SP1 (x86) software package from the Microsoft Download Center (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=63266).

segment.source: To install silently, use the command-line option /quiet—for example, msiexec /i msxml6x86.msi /quiet.
segment.target: To install silently, use the command-line option /quiet—for example, msiexec /i msxml6x86.msi /quiet.

segment.source: To install Microsoft Application Error Reporting
segment.target: To install Microsoft Application Error Reporting

segment.source: When installing Microsoft Application Error Reporting, you must use the APPGUID parameter to specify the App-V product code.
segment.target: When installing Microsoft Application Error Reporting, you must use the APPGUID parameter to specify the App-V product code.

segment.source: The product code is unique for each App-V client type and version.
segment.target: The product code is unique for each App-V client type and version.

segment.source: Select the correct product code from the following table.
segment.target: Select the correct product code from the following table.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For App-V 4.6 SP2 and later, you no longer need to install Microsoft Application Error Reporting (dw20shared.msi).
segment.target: For App-V 4.6 SP2 and later, you no longer need to install Microsoft Application Error Reporting (dw20shared.msi).

segment.source: App-V now uses Microsoft Error Reporting.
segment.target: App-V now uses Microsoft Error Reporting.

segment.target: Version

segment.target: ¹ App-V “Languages” release.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you need to find the product code, you can use the Orca.exe database editor or a similar tool to examine Windows Installer files to find the value of the ProductCode property.
segment.target: If you need to find the product code, you can use the Orca.exe database editor or a similar tool to examine Windows Installer files to find the value of the ProductCode property.

segment.source: For more information about using Orca.exe, see Windows Installer Development Tools (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=150008).
segment.target: For more information about using Orca.exe, see Windows Installer Development Tools (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=150008).

segment.source: Locate the Microsoft Application Error Reporting install program, dw20shared.msi, which can be found in the SupportWatson folder on the release media.
segment.target: Locate the Microsoft Application Error Reporting install program, dw20shared.msi, which can be found in the SupportWatson folder on the release media.

segment.source: To install the software, run the following command:
segment.target: To install the software, run the following command:

segment.source: Installing the App-V Client by Using the Setup.msi Program
segment.target: Installing the App-V Client by Using the Setup.msi Program

segment.source: Use the following procedure to install the App-V client.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to install the App-V client.

segment.source: Ensure that any necessary prerequisite software has been installed.
segment.target: Ensure that any necessary prerequisite software has been installed.

segment.source: Template Token Value For version 4.6 and later of the App-V client, the setup.msi program checks the system and if prerequisite software is not installed, it generates an error message indicating that installation cannot continue.
segment.target: Template Token Value For version 4.6 and later of the App-V client, the setup.msi program checks the system and if prerequisite software is not installed, it generates an error message indicating that installation cannot continue.

segment.source: Template Token Value
segment.target: Template Token Value

segment.source: To install the Application Virtualization Client by Using Setup.msi
segment.target: To install the Application Virtualization Client by Using Setup.msi

segment.source: Make sure you are logged on with an account that has administrator rights on the computer.
segment.target: Make sure you are logged on with an account that has administrator rights on the computer.

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt window by using elevated rights, and then change the directory to the folder that contains the setup files.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt window by using elevated rights, and then change the directory to the folder that contains the setup files.

segment.source: When installing version 4.6 or a later version of the App-V client, you must use the correct installer for the computer’s operating system, 32-bit or 64-bit.
segment.target: When installing version 4.6 or a later version of the App-V client, you must use the correct installer for the computer’s operating system, 32-bit or 64-bit.

segment.source: The installation will fail and an error message will be displayed if you use the wrong installer.
segment.target: The installation will fail and an error message will be displayed if you use the wrong installer.

segment.source: Enter the install command string at the command prompt.
segment.target: Enter the install command string at the command prompt.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can create a command file and run it from the command prompt.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can create a command file and run it from the command prompt.

segment.source: You can also use a scripting language such as VBScript or Windows PowerShell to run the command.
segment.target: You can also use a scripting language such as VBScript or Windows PowerShell to run the command.

segment.source: The following command-line example shows how setup.msi can be used with a number of optional parameters.
segment.target: The following command-line example shows how setup.msi can be used with a number of optional parameters.

segment.source: For more information about these parameters, see Application Virtualization Client Installer Command-Line Parameters.
segment.target: For more information about these parameters, see Application Virtualization Client Installer Command-Line Parameters.

segment.source: msiexec.exe /i "setup.msi" SWICACHESIZE="10240" SWIPUBSVRDISPLAY="Production System" SWIPUBSVRTYPE="HTTP /secure" SWIPUBSVRHOST="PRODSYS" SWIPUBSVRPORT="443" SWIPUBSVRPATH="/AppVirt/appsntype.xml" SWIPUBSVRREFRESH="on" SWIGLOBALDATA="D:AppVirtGlobal" SWIUSERDATA="^% LOCALAPPDATA^%WindowsApplication Virtualization Client" SWIFSDRIVE="S" /q
segment.target: msiexec.exe /i "setup.msi" SWICACHESIZE="10240" SWIPUBSVRDISPLAY="Production System" SWIPUBSVRTYPE="HTTP /secure" SWIPUBSVRHOST="PRODSYS" SWIPUBSVRPORT="443" SWIPUBSVRPATH="/AppVirt/appsntype.xml" SWIPUBSVRREFRESH="on" SWIGLOBALDATA="D:AppVirtGlobal" SWIUSERDATA="^% LOCALAPPDATA^%WindowsApplication Virtualization Client" SWIFSDRIVE="S" /q

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The Windows Installer switch "/q" is used to make this a silent installation.
segment.target: The Windows Installer switch "/q" is used to make this a silent installation.

segment.source: The "" characters in "%HomeDrive%" must be preceded by the "" escape character.
segment.target: The "" characters in "%HomeDrive%" must be preceded by the "" escape character.

segment.source: Otherwise, the Windows command shell sets the value to that of the user who is performing the installation.
segment.target: Otherwise, the Windows command shell sets the value to that of the user who is performing the installation.

segment.source: To turn on installation logging, use the msiexec switch /lv filename.log.
segment.target: To turn on installation logging, use the msiexec switch /lv filename.log.

segment.target: Related topics
